nostalgia.title: Windows 93
nostalgia.description: A fully functional, trippy recreation of classic Windows in your browser. Complete with games, apps, and Easter eggs.

nostalgia.title: Space Jam (1996) Official Website
nostalgia.description: The original Space Jam movie website, unchanged since 1996. Peak 90s web design with frames, GIFs, and Comic Sans.

nostalgia.title: Hampster Dance
nostalgia.description: One of the first viral internet phenomena. Dancing hamsters with looping music. Pure 90s chaos.

nostalgia.title: Windows 95 in Browser
nostalgia.description: Run the actual Windows 95 operating system in your browser. Includes Minesweeper, Paint, Solitaire.

nostalgia.title: Old Reddit
nostalgia.description: The original Reddit interface before the redesign. Minimal, fast, information-dense.

nostalgia.title: Geocities Archive
nostalgia.description: Browse archived Geocities websites. Peak personal web design from the early internet era.

nostalgia.title: The Eternal Maze Screensaver
nostalgia.description: The iconic 3D maze screensaver from Windows 95. Procedurally generated endless hallways.

nostalgia.title: Poolside FM
nostalgia.description: Vaporwave-inspired internet radio with retro Mac aesthetic. Summer vibes and nostalgic music.

nostalgia.title: Webamp - Winamp in Browser
nostalgia.description: Faithful recreation of Winamp 2.9 in the browser. It really whips the llama's ass.

nostalgia.title: Internet Archive - MS-DOS Games
nostalgia.description: Thousands of DOS games playable directly in your browser. Oregon Trail, Prince of Persia, Doom.

nostalgia.title: Zombo.com
nostalgia.description: Welcome to Zombocom. This is Zombocom. Welcome. The only limit is yourself. An internet mystery.

nostalgia.title: The Useless Web
nostalgia.description: Takes you to random useless but entertaining websites. Captures the playful spirit of early internet.

nostalgia.title: Windows XP Simulator
nostalgia.description: Experience Windows XP again. Includes the iconic startup sound, Bliss wallpaper, and classic UI.

nostalgia.title: Y2K Aesthetic Institute
nostalgia.description: Digital culture archive exploring Y2K era design, technology, and aesthetics. Glossy, futuristic, optimistic.

nostalgia.title: One Terabyte of Kilobyte Age
nostalgia.description: Tumblr showcasing screenshots from old Geocities pages. A museum of amateur web design.

nostalgia.title: AOL Instant Messenger Revival
nostalgia.description: Fan-made revival of AIM. Relive the door slam sound and away messages.

nostalgia.title: The Million Dollar Homepage
nostalgia.description: A student sold 1 million pixels for $1 each. Peak mid-2000s internet entrepreneurship.

nostalgia.title: Flash Game Archive - Flashpoint
nostalgia.description: Preserving 100,000+ Flash games and animations. Download to play classics from Newgrounds, Miniclip.

nostalgia.title: Neopets Classic
nostalgia.description: The original virtual pet site, still running. Feed your Neopet and play Flash-free games.

nostalgia.title: FFFFOUND! Archive
nostalgia.description: Iconic invite-only image bookmarking site. Frozen in time but archives still viewable.

nostalgia.title: Club Penguin Rewritten
nostalgia.description: Fan-made recreation of Club Penguin after Disney shut it down. Waddle on!

nostalgia.title: Wayback Machine
nostalgia.description: Browse 866 billion archived web pages. See any website as it looked in the past.

nostalgia.title: ASCII Art Archive
nostalgia.description: Massive collection of ASCII art from BBS days and early internet. Copy-paste nostalgia.

nostalgia.title: Old Games Download
nostalgia.description: Free downloads of classic PC games. DOS, Windows 95/98 era games.

nostalgia.title: Textfiles.com
nostalgia.description: Archive of BBS textfiles. Hacker manifestos, phreaking guides, ANSI art. Raw internet history.

nostalgia.title: Neocities
nostalgia.description: Free web hosting inspired by Geocities. Modern take on personal homepages and creative freedom.
